meanings.definition: The act of propitiating or appeasing a god, spirit, or person.
meanings.sent1: During the ceremony, the priest performed propitiations to please the ancient deity.
meanings.sent2: The villagers made propitiations to the river spirit to ensure a bountiful harvest.
meanings.sent3: The propitiations to the grumpy neighbor involved leaving cookies at his doorstep.
meanings.sent4: Her propitiations to the strict teacher included always completing her homework on time.
meanings.sent5: The propitiations to the mischievous cat involved offering it a new toy every day.

meanings.definition: Something that propitiates, such as a sacrifice or offering.
meanings.sent1: The ancient tribe believed that their propitiations would bring them good fortune.
meanings.sent2: The propitiations left at the shrine were meant to ward off evil spirits.
meanings.sent3: His propitiations of chocolates always seemed to make his friends forgive him.
meanings.sent4: The propitiations of flowers were a symbol of peace and reconciliation.
meanings.sent5: The propitiations of incense filled the temple with a sweet fragrance.
